text: Okay, first of all, Yeah, we're going. Okay, the Science Fiction Writers Association of America, I'm sorry. Science Fiction Writers of America. Okay, why did you want the job as president? Why did I want the job as president? I don't know. That's really a hard question to answer. I don't know why because somebody had to do it because I felt I was the most qualified person to do it at the time. Because I've been involved in the organization from the beginning. I've been vice president. I've been the agreements chairman. And I've always, from time to time, felt that it was going off and wrong in stupid directions. And finally I felt that there were a certain number of things that I could get done in this period, and that this was the time to do it. always felt I would be president of the things sooner or later. And this just seemed to be the right time to do it. Jack Williamson had been president, and he had dealt with a lot of internal bickering and things like that, which I wasn't interested in dealing with at all. I think one of the flaws of the organization had always been that it was too inward-looking, and I wanted to see it more outward-looking. So after Jack had dealt with a good deal of this organizational stuff, it felt it was a good time for me to come in and change the emphasis. Okay, could you just tell me a little bit about What kind of things would you be interested in doing or changing? What I'm interested in, one thing that I'm already halfway through getting done is to internationalize it. It's to have an overseas region with an overseas director on our board of directors. Because science fiction writing and publishing really is an international community. American writers sell their work all over the world. English writers sell their work here. Foreign language writers have different problems. We're all dealing with the same publishers. It certainly is an international literature and it's a spirit of the future and the spirit of internationalism and so forth. I felt it should be an international organization. That's one thing. Another thing that I want to do when halfway to doing is upgrading the Nebula Awards. We have moved it out of the Warwick Hotel. We're moving it into a much bigger room in the world and trying to make it into a more significant event than it has been. Again, orienting it towards the world at large rather than towards the little in group. Another thing that I would like to do with it is make it act more like a union. it has evolved in that direction we now have a large and complete grievance committee we do act like a union in that sense times are getting rough now it's a time when you need a more militant guilt to science fiction writers than you need in the past few years and I've tried to orient it a little bit more in that direction too those are the basic things that I want to do with it the ways I want to see it go okay listen David wanted me to ask you this. We want to go to World Con. It's going to be in Denver, we understand, next year. How does one go about registering for that? Well, I don't know. This is not on the table. No.
